title.narrative: QUALITY INCLUSIVE EDUCATION (3-17)

description.narrative: By 2020, the education system has increased capacity to provide quality inclusive education for vulnerable children 3-17 years old (including refugee children)., which contributes to Early Learning, Education â€“ General, Equitable Access To Quality Education, Equitable Access To Quality Education (Covid), Equity â€“ Focus On Girls' And Inclusive Education, Learning And Child-Friendly Schools, Learning Outcomes. UNICEF aims to achieve this through Advocacy And Public Engagement, Systems Strengthening And Institution Building. This contributes to the following Country Programme result: By 2020, the education, child and social protection and health systems, NGOs, communities and families provide vulnerable children with increasingly inclusive opportunities to realize their rights to protection, education, development and participationBy 2020, the education, child and social protection and health systems, NGOs, communities and families provide vulnerable children with increasingly inclusive opportunities to realize their rights to protection, education, development and participation.

Education sector planning including coordinating role, SDG 4, etc.
Provision of (formal and non-formal) early-learning / pre-primary education (including in temporary learning spaces)

System strengthening - mother tongue / multilingual education
System strengthening - risk informed programming, including climate, resilience, disaster, conflict, and emergency preparedness
System strengthening - teacher development, management, and support

condition.narrative: Should contribute directly to results for children as outlined in the UNDAF, national results and/or UNICEF Strategic Plan and within the scope defined in the CPD, CPAP, OMP or other agreed upon programme documents

title.narrative: By 2020, the education system has increased capacity to provide quality inclusive education for vulnerable children 3-17 years old (including refugee children).

description.narrative: UNICEF has contributed to strengthening the capacity of the education system to provide quality inclusive education for most vulnerable children in the Turkish public-school system, with a special focus on the revision of educational legislation (i.e., special education regulation, counselling services regulation, early childhood and primary education institution regulation), development/revision of education programs (i.e., Remedial Education, Psychosocial Support modules, assessment framework for children with disabilities, school and classroom based assessment training modules) and educational support materials, provision of educational personnel training, provision of awareness raising activities, building capacity of research and counselling centres and review of assessment policy and practice. | Status:On-track | As-of Date:15/01/2020

title.narrative: # of educational personnel trained (Syrian/Turkish, Female/Male) in relation to quality inclusive education
In-service teacher training includes modules on inclusive education in line with international good practices

baseline.value: In-service teacher training modules only implicitly include elements on inclusive education

target.value: 2020:In-service teacher training includes modules on inclusive education in line with international good practice

actual.value: 2019:Development of Inclusive education Teaching Modules were completed and adopted by MoNE.

title.narrative: The country has an effective education system for learning outcomes, including early learning (Indicator in RAM is "System Strengthening - Early learning - Existence of effective governance for early learning" It is can't be picked up form the standard indicators under 1B)

actual.value: 2019:2.55 (average based on the SMQ-22-02-2.b.3-3 to b.3-11)

title.narrative: Education assessment system includes tools & frameworks targeting all vulnerable students in line with international standards

baseline.value: There are assessment frameworks and tools that partially meet the needs of some vulnerable students

target.value: 2020:Education assessment tools and frameworks in line with international standards are disseminated throughout the education system

actual.value: 2019:ECE and Primary Education Frameworks and relevant assessment tools for CwD were developed and tested in 12 provinces.

title.narrative: Existence of appropriate law/policy explicitly mentioning the rights of children with disabilities to receive an education

baseline.value: There is a law/policy establishing the right of all children to attend school, which does not explicitely mention CWDs

target.value: 2019:Legislation on inclusive education explicitely mentioning the rights of CWDs is endorsed

actual.value: 2019:The legislation regarding the education services offered to CwD was revised in 2018 by MoNE
